subsection.name: Bootstrap CLI Options
subsection.p: The -Xbootstrap cli option is recognized by the Transit Main class and is used to establish the application launcher plugin uri.

tr.td: The uri of the application launcher to be used. This value is normally set by the transit commandline script. The value declared under the script is the artifact uri "@TRANSIT-PLUGIN-URI@". The loaded plugin is required to handle the cli options described below.

subsection.name: Standard CLI Options
subsection.p: The transit application launcher evaluates the supplied commandline arguments and processes only those arguments applicable to itself. Remaining arguments are forwarded on to the application that is the target of a launch request.
The standard CLI Options recognized by the launcher are listed in the following table.

tr.td: Enable stacktrace and debug message reporting.
A two-letter language code to provide hooks for I18N.

Transit loads the (single) plugin from the supplied artifact URI. If the plugin is an instance of java.lang.Runnable, it will be started by the controller using the start() method. A shutdown hook is added to the newly loaded plugin to enable clean shutdown together with the transit instance.
For example, Metro is started via:
transit -load @METRO-PLUGIN-URI@
